intro: Pseudotrewia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pseudotrewia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds.
